summary:
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

We have class WMSControlWidget: base class for WMS control widget, provides GUI elements and common functionality to access a WMS. Not instantiated directly; subclass for horizontal/vertical.

Methods: many helpers for UI interactions, retrieving images, caching, capabilities, time navigation, level navigation, etc. So class responsibility: manage interaction with a Web Map Service (WMS) server, providing UI controls for selecting layers, styles, time ranges, zoom levels, handling caching, retrieving map images, displaying progress, handling errors, etc.

Business intent: enable applications to integrate WMS map layers, allowing users to browse and retrieve map images from WMS servers, with time and level controls, caching, etc.

Keywords: WMS, Web Map Service, GUI, map retrieval, caching, capabilities, time navigation, layer selection, style, level, image fetching, progress dialog, error handling.

Now produce JSON.

Make sure no method names verbatim. Provide summary, business_intent, keywords list.

Let's craft.

Summary: "Base widget that supplies the graphical interface and core logic for interacting with a Web Map Service (WMS), handling layer selection, style, time and level navigation, image retrieval, caching and error handling."

Business intent: "Allow client applications to embed WMS map browsing capabilities, letting users explore and fetch map images from WMS 1.1.1/1.3.0 servers through an intuitive UI."

Keywords list: ["WMS", "Web Map Service", "GUI", "map layer selection", "style management", "time navigation", "level navigation", "image retrieval", "caching", "capabilities parsing", "error handling", "progress dialog", "client integration"].

Now output JSON.

Make sure format: {"summary": "...", "business_intent": "...", "keywords": [...]}

Let's produce.assistantfinal{"summary":"Base widget that supplies the graphical interface and core logic for interacting with a Web Map Service (WMS), handling layer and style selection, time and level navigation, image retrieval, caching and error handling.", "business_intent":"Enable client applications to embed WMS map browsing capabilities, allowing users to explore and fetch map images from WMS 1.1.1/1.3.0 servers through an intuitive UI.", "keywords":["WMS","Web Map Service","GUI","map layer selection","style management","time navigation","level navigation","image
